meanings.sent1: She tends to reluctate before making important decisions.
meanings.sent2: I reluctate when it comes to trying new foods.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to reluctate when faced with the challenge of crossing the narrow bridge.
meanings.sent4: His feet reluctated to move forward as if glued to the ground.
meanings.sent5: The student reluctated to raise their hand in class, fearing the wrong answer.

meanings.definition: To be hesitant or unwilling to do something
meanings.sent1: They reluctate to join group activities due to shyness.
meanings.sent2: People often reluctate to change their routines.
meanings.sent3: The dog reluctated to take a bath, hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: Her mind reluctated to accept the harsh reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The old car reluctated to start on cold mornings, needing extra care.
